page.title: 10A School Day 9.10am.-10.30am
page.content: We arrive at school and go onto the layground. When the bell is rung by teacher on duty at 9.10am. we line up until we are told to go in. Inside we hang up our coats and change into indoor shoes. We then sit down and read a book whilst the registers are called. When these have been done some people are told what work has to be done, whilst others like myself know what to do and can decide for ourselves the order in which we want to work. In the morning I usually choose to do maths before playtime. I have done basic maths this year which includes addition, subtraction, multiplication, fractions etc. I have also done a lot of practical maths connected with the class project. For example, I have tested the strength of card bridges and concrete beams, and timed the speed of different moving things.
